data.title: News
data.meta_description: News and press release about current and past productions.
data.text:
Munich, January 18th 2024 – Michael Bully Herbig and Constantin Film are delighted to announce the sequel to Der Schuh des Manitu, one of the most successful German films of all time. Based on sketches from the comedy show “bullyparade”, Bully created the film “Der Schuh des Manitu” in 2001, a parody of the Winnetou…

Read more

Munich, December 16th, 2019 The final take on the set of Boandlkramer’s Eternal Love (orig. Der Boandlkramer und die ewige Liebe) was completed just in time for the Christmas holidays. Now the Grim Reaper, aka “Boandlkramer” will no longer cause any chaos in heaven and the angels can return to their Christmas preparations in peace. Director…

Read more

Dublin, February 27th, 2019 „An outrageous real-life escape story which is brought to the screen in brilliantly sense and nerve-shredding style.” – Gráinne Humphreys, Festival Director Michael Bully Herbig celebrated the Ireland premiere of Balloon, his spectacular film, an adaptation of the true story about a flight from East Germany, at the Virgin Media Dublin…

Read more

Munich, February 22nd, 2019 For the 18th time the Bernhard Wicki Memorial Fund will be honoring the work of outstanding film makers. The prize is awarded to German and international films that stand out both in terms of their artistic vision and the human and political dimension they convey. Roundabout 50 symbolic bridge piers have…

Read more

Berlin, November 22nd, 2018 Only a few weeks after its world premiere Michael Bully Herbig´s spellbinding thriller Balloon has been sold to numerous countries around the world. In Europe these are countries such as Benelux States, France, Greece, Italy, Spain, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Hungary and other East-European countries. In North America so far distribution rights…

Read more

Berlin, June 29t, 2018 The newly published trailer lets audiences immerse in an unbelievable adventure based on a true story: In 1979, the families Strelzyk and Wetzel ventured to escape from the GDR to freedom with a homemade hot-air balloon – eight people in a tiny gondola. Based on their story, director Michael Bully Herbig…

Read more

Munich, March 19th, 2018 3 weeks after release Bullyparade – The Movie (orig. Bullyparade – Der Film) tops the charts at Prime Video, the most popular video streaming portal in Germany. The first weekend after cinema release Bullyparade – The Movie achived the best release of a German movie of the last 2 years. For the…

Read more

December 1st, 2017 After 50 exciting days of shooting, the last slate for the movie Balloon was announced. Michael Bully Herbig´s nerve-racking thriller is based on the true story of one of the most spectacular escapes from East Germany. On September 16th, 1979 the families Strelzyk and Wetzel attempt to cross the border to West…

Read more

Munich, September 18th 2017 Michael Bully Herbig is back behind the camera again: today was the first day of principal photography for Balloon a thriller with a stellar cast: Friedrich Mücke (SMS For You), Karoline Schuch (Katharina Luther), David Kross (The Reader), Alicia von Rittberg (Charité) and Thomas Kretschmann (Valkyrie) to name a few. Based on…

Read more

Munich, August 20th, 2017 Bully´s new whacky episodic movie achieves the best start of a German movie in 2017, and conquers first position of the German film charts straightaway. Cinemas report applause after the movie, tears of laughter and most of all perfectly happy fans. This is great news for screenwriter and director Michael Bully Herbig and his…

Read more

Munich, August 17th 2017 Two guys from Zwickau with a historic mission. Two blood brothers and their greatest adventure. Monarchs on a journey into the dark. An entire planet populated by gorgeous women. All combined in a single film! August 17th is going to be the day, Bullyparade – Der Film (orig. Bullyparade – Der Film)…

Read more

Munich, January 9th, 2018 Movie blockbuster BULLYPARADE – The Movie (orig. Bullyparade – Der Film) exclusively available on Prime Video, Germany´s most popular video-streaming platform, from February 17th 2018. Hence all Michael Bully Herbig fans with a Prime membership can watch the movie just 7 months after its theatrical release, and long before it is aired…

Read more

Munich, June 4th, 2013 Michael Bully Herbig’s new comedy will be out on Christmas From 25 December 2013 in cinemas nationwide Synopsis: Eddie (Alexander Fehling) is living a good life: big bucks, big cars and lots of chicks. Yet since partying is more important to him than the company his late father left him, sales…

Read more

Munich, May 13th, 2013 The first action shot! The first scene of BUDDY was shot on March 4th, and the last scene will be completed on the 49th day of filming. Then “it’s a wrap!” for the sixth Bully movie! In order to shorten the waiting time for fans left hanging in suspense, Warner Bros.…

Read more

Munich, January 29th, 2013 Alexander Fehling and Mina Tander in the new comedy produced by and starring Michael Bully Herbig Start of production: March 4th, 2013 Germany’s most successful director is shooting a new movie! Almost four years have gone by since Michael Bully Herbig directed his last motion picture, Wickie und die starken Männer.…

Read more

Unterföhring, January 28th, 2013 Michael Bully Herbig and the German TV station ProSieben are opening up a new chapter in their long and fruitful collaboration: in the 2013/14 television season, the successful German director, actor, comedian and screenwriter will air a new TV format on ProSieben. Michael Bully Herbig: “I have now been collaborating with…

Read more

Munich, March 14th, 2012 Warner Bros. seals deal for Bully’s next two movies! Michael Bully Herbig, Germany’s most successful filmmaker, and his production company, herbX film, have signed a first-look deal with Warner Bros. for two feature films. After four years and after having starred in several movies (including Hotel Lux and Zettl), Michael Bully…

Read more

Geiselgasteig, May 29th, 2012 It came as a complete surprise and was absolutely spontaneous: Michael Bully Herbig held an autograph session in the “Bullyversum” movie adventure world. The meeting between the popular comedian, actor and director and his fans took a little more than one hour. Asked why he did that, Bully replied: “I finally…

Read more

Rome, March 14th, 2017 Standing ovations, “Bravos” and endless applause! As part of the feature-length film competition, Hotel Lux premiered in Italy during this year‘s International Rome Film Festival. The audience was absolutely blown away, and director Leander Haußmann and the movie’s leading actors Michael Bully Herbig and Thekla Reuten raised quite a cheer from…

Read more

Geiselgasteig, March 14th, 2017 Enormous crowds for the opening Since Tuesday, June 14th, 2011, Munich´s studio lot and theme park, Bavaria Filmstadt has a new and unique attraction: the BULLYVERSUM – an adventure world of a new dimension! On approx. 1,500 m2, visitors can embark on an interactive and surprising journey through the world of…

Read more

Munich, August 31st, 2009 Before Vicky the Viking first set sail on the big screen on September 9th, the Mathäser Filmpalast theater in Munich, Germany, presented the smartest Viking of all times in a one-of-a-kind world premiere – and everybody was over the moon!

Read more

Berlin, September 25th, 2008 Alongside the full cast of the MANITOU’S SHOE musical, blood brothers Ranger und Abahachi moved into Berlin’s Theater of the (Wild) West for the start of rehearsals for the acclaimed Western movie spoof turned musical, which is to make its world premiere in Berlin on 7 December.

Read more

Munich, March 14th, 2017 Michael Bully Herbig’s New Feature Film Registers More Than 10,000 Viewers Well Before Opening Day! Shooting several sequences of his new movie Vicky the Viking, Bully spent just under three weeks at Lake Walchensee in Bavaria, Germany, a location starring as Vicky’s hometown of Flake, which was brought to life with…

Read more

Munich, 22nd November, 2007 Again, number one among German cinemagoers on weekend three. A German loyalty pledge to Lissi, Franz and Bully! For the third week in a row, Lissi and the Wild Emperor shoots to the top of the German cinema charts. Three weeks after opening day, more than 1.7 million moviegoers poured into…

Read more

Munich, September 20th, 2004 Nobody had done this before! In 2001, Michael Bully Herbig (together with Constantin Film) was the first German filmmaker to be awarded the Golden Screen with Two Stars (Goldene Leinwand mit zwei Sternen)! Now, only three years later, the successful team is in for another sensation: last night, upon registering a…

Read more

Munich, August 05th, 2004 More than 2.16 million admissions during the first 4 days! Best summer debut of all times! Record results at the box-office turn the outer-space comedy into the most successful summertime release of all times!

Read more
